things_to_do

Culture shock doesn't get much more shocking than your first visit to Tokyo. From the kaleidoscopic bright lights and skyscrapers to the maze-like backstreets and intricate rituals associated with everything from shrines to sumo, Tokyo can be simultaneously confounding and thrilling. Whether it's your first visit or your 15th, expert-led Tokyo tours will unveil even the most seemingly impenetrable parts of the city, whether it's the back alley bars of Shinjuku or a traditional tea ceremony room.

People Also Ask

What are the best tours in Tokyo?

There are plenty of high-quality tours in Tokyo. Looking at ratings and reviews previously given by customers, these are the best tours available right now:

  • Mt Fuji and Hakone 1-Day Bus Tour Return by Bullet Train
  • 1-Day Tokyo Bus Tour
  • Flagship 2-Hours Official Street Go-Kart Tour - Tokyo Bay Shop
  • Tokyo Bar Hopping Night Tour in Shinjuku
  • Tokyo 6hr Private Tour with Government-Licensed Guide
Are Tokyo guided tours worth it?

Yes. Tokyo is a vibrant global hub that can feel very busy and overwhelming to visitors, so many travelers agree that guided tours are well worth it. Whether you want to explore Tokyos iconic landmarksmaybe even with skip-the-line access to the towering Skytreeor escape the city for natural wonders around Mt. Fuji and Hakone, theres a tour that fits the bill. You can even book an izakaya bar-hopping adventure for a locals take on the best of the city.


According to one customer who booked the Tokyo 6hr Private Tour with Government-Licensed Guide, Shuji Yokoyamaa was an amazing guide. He contacted us weeks before to set an itinerary that was perfect for us. He also asked about our food preferences so our lunch would be enjoyable. Shuji is extremely knowledgeable about Tokyo and gave us so much information both historical and current trends. It was fascinating and very enjoyable.

How much do Tokyo tours cost?

That depends. You can book walking tours, local bar hopping tours, and tea ceremonies for under US$35. On the other hand, private sightseeing tours to Mt. Fuji or full-day customized city tours can cost upwards of US$100$150 per person, depending on your groups activities and size. Youll find even pricier, multi-day tours that offer a full itinerary of events throughout Japan.


On the lower end of the price scale, there are tours such as Tokyo Tsukiji Market Food and Culture Walking Tour for around US$11 per person. This walking tour showcases Tsukijis diverse food spots, although tastings arent included along the way. Pricier options include tours such as Snow Monkeys from Tokyo: Full-Day Private Trip with Local Guide (around US$3,077 per group), with private transport to Nagano, admission to Jigokudani Snow Monkey Park, and a private driver-guide.

What do you see on Tokyo tours?

Depending on the type of tour, youll see many different sides of Tokyo. If you choose a 1-day bus, walking, rickshaw, or e-bike tour, expect to see the citys iconic landmarks such as the Imperial Palace, Sensoji Temple, and Tokyo Skytree. You can also observe a tea ceremony and bar hop and sample local cuisine on Tokyos food and drink excursions.


Consider an all-day tour to help you check as many Tokyo landmarks off your list as possible. As an example, the Tokyo Guided Small-Group Biking Tour visits Yoyogi Park, Meiji Jingu Shrine, and the Imperial Palace. It also showcases the backstreets of Ginza and views of Tokyos skyline from the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building.

How many days in Tokyo is enough?

Most travelers find 45 days in Tokyo the perfect time to hit the most iconic sights and get a feel for the city. But if you've got the time, stay up to seven days to experience Tokyo's diverse neighborhoods and incredible culture.

Is Tokyo a cheap city to visit?

While Tokyo has a reputation for being an expensive city, there are ways to visit on a budget if you know where to look. Public transportation is super efficient, and you can find affordable food at local joints and street vendors. Planning and researching ahead of time can help manage costs and make your trip more affordable.
